newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: G.E. Crane sees improved business climate.
newsitem.headline: G.E. Crane sees improved business climate.

text.p: Metal distribution group G.E. Crane Holdings Ltd said on Monday it expected local business conditions to improve in the six months to December 31, 1997 and become stonger in the following six months.
"We expect the domestic climate to improve modestly in the first half of 1997/98 and become stronger in the second half," managing director John Ingram said in a statement.
G.E. Crane earlier reported a 41 percent increase in net profit to A$28.95 million for the year to June 30, 1997.
"The Crane group will continue to plan for the long term by focusing on organic growth and on acquisitions compatible with our core competencies," Ingram said.

Group turnover rose six percent to A$945 million in the 1996/97 year. The net profit included an abnormal gain of A$2.3 million, which relates to the net effect of two items arising from a review of the company's investments.
On Friday, G.E. Crane shares closed 15 cents lower at A$13.30.
